channel.title: 纽约时报热门
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title:
Sarah Weddington was just 26 years old when she successfully argued Roe v. Wade before the Supreme Court, leading to the legalization of abortion throughout the U.S.
She died on Sunday at her home in Austin, at age 76. https://t.co/CnRUe4iofP

Breaking News: The CDC halved the recommended coronavirus isolation period to five days, saying that infected Americans without symptoms could safely resume mixing with others with masks five days after their positive test results. https://t.co/hSIOxCGET7
Thousands more flights were canceled on Monday as Omicron surged. Dr. Anthony Fauci said a vaccine mandate for air travel should be considered. https://t.co/QgL8wR6jjf

A Harvard professor for 46 years, Edward O. Wilson, was an expert on insects and explored how natural selection and other forces could influence animal behavior. He then applied his research to humans and pioneered new fields of research. https://t.co/EXINE3hWBj https://t.co/j08LE3tks8
Active, physically fit men and women are more than twice as likely to be moderate or heavy drinkers as people who are out of shape, a new study found. https://t.co/q4Fbwcqipw
Edward O. Wilson, a biologist and author who conducted pioneering work on biodiversity, insects and human nature, has died at 92. https://t.co/o0cRtnu62F
One of the easiest ways to upgrade your mask protection is to wear two at the same time, health experts say. Here are answers to common questions about double masking. https://t.co/M3lmTZ19qc

Peter Dinklage is happy to upend 100 years of clichés by playing the romantic lead. The four-time Emmy winner spoke to us about the new movie musical “Cyrano" and life after "Game of Thrones." https://t.co/4OnW9Mm3op
Witnessing Desmond Tutu get singled out for a body search at the airport in 1986, our reporter saw his singular resilience, and humor. https://t.co/QyrERYy6ZF
Breaking News: Jean-Marc Vallée, the Oscar-nominated director known for the critically acclaimed “Dallas Buyers Club” and TV’s “Big Little Lies,” is dead at 58. https://t.co/wLMo9wuVIr

Feminist groups spent years defying the law in Mexico, helping thousands of women get abortions. Now that abortions are legal in Mexico, these activists are bringing their mission to the U.S. https://t.co/YnLJ55l5iT

Though Desmond Tutu formally retired from public life in 2010 — promising to quietly sip tea with his wife and visit his grandchildren — he continued to advocate for what he saw as just and fair, serving as a moral compass for South Africa. https://t.co/pEk4WCoRaO

Breaking News: Wayne Thiebaud, the California-based painter known for his lush, dreamy landscapes and luminous pictures of hot dogs, deli counters, marching band majorettes and other charmed relics of midcentury Americana, has died at 101. https://t.co/sf1ab7Rssy
Dr. Fauci said the nation’s low vaccination rate — only 62 percent of Americans are fully vaccinated — would likely dilute the benefits of Omicron’s reduced virulence. https://t.co/lod0ZxF6cX

We interviewed Carrie-Anne Moss, who played Trinity in "The Matrix," about returning to the role years later for the new sequel: "It was important to me that I let go of any construct in my mind that I needed to look like I did when I was 30." https://t.co/wgKoaLfL4j
See 2021 in pictures: https://t.co/YdhXyxTAUQ https://t.co/PsW5qlYAn6

Elijah Wood kept a pair of hairy hobbit feet in the same box they were given to him in for over 20 years, reminding him of his time in "The Lord of the Rings" trilogy. As he reflects on his career, he knows that to some fans, he will always be Frodo. https://t.co/FpKx688sI4
Desmond Tutu’s legacy, many said, was one of unity and service, built on a life of campaigning for dignity for people everywhere and helping bridge divides. https://t.co/DnpUTEbxQB
Desmond Tutu, the Nobel Peace Prize-winning archbishop and chairman of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission who helped bring down apartheid in South Africa, has died at 90. https://t.co/G06dBduqyG

The New York State Department of Health is urging parents to get all children who are 5 and older vaccinated, citing a jump in pediatric hospitalizations associated with the coronavirus. https://t.co/kZNu1etSUj
Breaking News: Desmond Tutu has died at 90. The archbishop, whose powerful voice helped slay apartheid in South Africa, earned a Nobel Peace Prize in 1984. https://t.co/I1HjXsP5oE

Instead of taking holiday vacations this weekend, hospitals workers across the U.S. are working 16-hour shifts. Some have been on the job every day for weeks.
“This is the worst I’ve ever seen it,” said Maureen May, a nurse with 37 years of experience. https://t.co/A8N5O1tlcd

The Chinese authorities have declared war on content deemed to be "flaunting wealth." Online posts by users showing off their receipts, over-ordering food or scattering money have been deemed vulgar. https://t.co/55islSlUIg
A new eye drop could make misplaced reading glasses less of an inconvenience for many of the 128 million Americans who suffer from age-related deficits in near vision. https://t.co/1YbaE8XksS
A U.S. Navy ship is stranded in the port at Guantánamo Bay, Cuba, with a coronavirus outbreak among its fully vaccinated crew. https://t.co/mbDlxKXbgi

Some unvaccinated American adults said that Omicron’s ability to infect vaccinated people only reaffirmed their decision to not get the shot. Others say the virus’s changing nature has stiffened their resolve not to get it. https://t.co/JF4OqwB6Zo https://t.co/OiFBa2G1Cf

The James Webb Space Telescope, the dreams and work of a generation of astronomers, headed for an orbit around the sun on Christmas Day. Astronomers jubilantly watched the launch remotely from all over the world, many Zooming together in their pajamas. https://t.co/mQ8RMFHDY4

An Italian factory worker was dealing with a lifelong impairment that made it hard to work, but he wasn’t in a position to retire. Then his co-workers gave him 20 months’ worth of vacation days. https://t.co/KRf4DPaUN2

Individually, books are frequently useful or delightful, but it is when books are displayed en masse that they really work wonders. Covering the walls of a room and exuding the breath of generations, they nourish the senses, slay boredom and relieve stress.https://t.co/qp7nW8hpGX

High schoolers across the U.S. have reported some of the most alarming mental health declines, evidenced by depression and suicide attempts. Adolescents have failed classes critical to their futures at higher rates than in previous years. https://t.co/qAHy2ab728

“Although it’s a time of great happiness and good cheer for many, Christmas can be hard for those who have lost loved ones,” Queen Elizabeth II said in her first Christmas address since the death of her husband. “This year, especially, I understand why.” https://t.co/VBgwj8SFvT

Should birth-control pills be made available over the counter rather than requiring a prescription? This is the heart of a debate now playing out in the pharmaceutical industry and at the FDA. https://t.co/SRKQRkGgIZ

George Floyd’s murder set in motion shock waves that touched almost every aspect of American society. But on the core issues of police violence and accountability, very little has changed. https://t.co/tHx4doxW4I

The Webb telescope, the most powerful space observatory ever built, lifted off Christmas morning. It will be orbiting the sun at a point beyond the moon, a million miles from Earth, which is way out of the reach of astronaut help. https://t.co/48NIDE89He https://t.co/fP2mcfb4qM
Breaking News: The Webb telescope, the biggest space observatory ever built, launched on its million-mile journey to the morning of time. https://t.co/1BKxlAxdt6

A wealthy family in Myanmar known for its charity work has secretly helped equip the country's brutal military and evaded Western scrutiny, an investigation by The New York Times has found. https://t.co/gNCMvItaUx

ပြင်ပကမ္ဘာအတွက်ဆိုလျှင် ဗမာ-အိုင်ယာလန် ကပြားမိသားစုသည် မြန်မာနိုင်ငံပြုပြင်ပြောင်းလဲရေးကို လိုလားသော အထက်တန်းစားများအဖြစ် သိကြပါမည်။ သို့သော် ထိုမိသားစုသည် ရက်စက်ကြမ်းကြုတ်သော စစ်တပ်ကို တိတ်တဆိတ် လက်နက်တပ်ဆင်ထားသည်။ https://t.co/V9DW8BrDGz

Denzel Washington and Frances McDormand play a toxic power couple in Joel Coen’s crackling adaptation of "Macbeth." The film is an NYT Critic's Pick. "Every scene is a mini-master class in the craft of acting." https://t.co/bQV12ZRv18

South Africa’s government, buoyed by data showing that infections from the Omicron variant aren’t as severe, has dropped quarantine restrictions for all but symptomatic people. https://t.co/gMCan4W1eo

High schoolers across the U.S. have reported some of the most alarming mental health declines, evidenced by depression and suicide attempts. Adolescents have failed classes critical to their futures at higher rates than in previous years. https://t.co/oyQCKZ29By https://t.co/Q1nvy2Ebug

Hundreds of right-wing Hindu activists and monks at a conference took an oath to harm Muslims if necessary to make “a Hindu-only nation,” the most blatant and alarming example of rising anti-Muslim sentiment across India. https://t.co/uFEvcLNdqg

Peter Dinklage is happy to upend 100 years of clichés by playing the romantic lead. The four-time Emmy winner spoke to us about the new movie musical “Cyrano" and life after "Game of Thrones." https://t.co/zteRagLLQU

A Los Angeles police officer opened fire on a man who was involved in an assault at a clothing store on Thursday, and one of the shots pierced a wall, killing a 14-year-old girl in a dressing room, the police said. https://t.co/PslsmVPXXT

The Elf on a Shelf is not, several privacy organizations were careful to say, the biggest threat the world faces. But they fear he teaches children to passively accept constantly being watched by an unseen authority figure. https://t.co/tGWQAV9yqd

An Australian landowner and two companies have been hit with hundreds of animal cruelty charges after a land-clearing operation last year led to the deaths of 70 koalas, an episode that one lawmaker described as a “massacre.” https://t.co/X8s4VE52qN

Canada will compensate Indigenous people for the decades that many have lived with contaminated drinking water.
The government will also commit to spend at least 6 billion Canadian dollars to fund clean-up efforts on hundreds of Indigenous reserves. https://t.co/OfdmJ63uSg

Joan Didion, the author of "The Year of Magical Thinking," "Slouching Towards Bethlehem" and "The White Album," to name a few, died on Thursday. She was also a prolific writer for The New York Times. https://t.co/jW5jY5WYie

The flu virus, which all but disappeared in early 2020, has re-emerged in the U.S. as the Omicron variant has driven up coronavirus infections and travel is expected to increase over the holidays. https://t.co/ED6CJUz23N https://t.co/prqBj3njrm

Kimberly Potter, the former police officer who fatally shot Daunte Wright after seeming to mistake her gun for her Taser, was convicted of two counts of manslaughter on Thursday. A judge will sentence Potter at a hearing scheduled for February. https://t.co/BzgG17WVcV https://t.co/4NE4c44BaL

Joan Didion was a generation-defining writer. "She could not tire of telling her reader, telling herself, that luck runs out — perhaps because she never really believed it, not when there was more life to be lived," writes Parul Sehgal. https://t.co/huEzeSeQNx https://t.co/W31qEGrMfe
